name: Ninja's and Spice (13th Place Portland Regional)
description: Inspired by the guys at Bad Publicity. This is the version of the deck that I took to the Portland Regional Tournament. You can find a complete tournament report here: http://www.projectmulligan.com/android-netrunner-portland-regional-after-action-report/

name: Taxing HB
description:
Standard stuff really. 1 Caprice to free up inf for some outside ice.

More taxing than FA, so no SanSan this time.

name: Exile - Dinosaurus 1.0
Painting The Rose's Red
description:
This is very much a theory deck, the idea been to use the Paintbrush to Open up options rather than relying on it as a crutch.

The grimoire is their mainly for the MU rather than the virus counters tho they cud come in handy also

Test-runs and same old things for search and alot of econ because this deck will suck up money installing everything.

I am not sure this would even work but its an idea Comments more than welcome.

name: ChaosT-Hardware-Overkill/mind
description: "Continually Always Watching" (by Old Jim) a little tweaked for killdecks

name: Spooky Granddad
description:
This is a deck still in development, it is fun to play but I don't know if it competitive, need to play more games with it.

Standard combo: The idea of John Masanori + Data Leak Reversal + Crash Space is not new, however Iain fits it perfectly, since you can gather enough credits to make a final run on Archives with Crypsis without moving a finger. At some point, the game is just "Trash 2, your turn".

Try to get out Mr. Li ASAP! Mulligan for him or Hostage. Facecheck any corp servers for an ICE that only ends the run, as Johnny wants to give you a tag. Get out the combo fast, then let the corp play its game.

Extended combo: If trashing 2 cards is not good enough for you, you can extend it to 3 cards a turn via Joshua B. and New Angeles City Hall. However, you need to pump your Crypsis still, so you'd need Access to Globalsec and at least 1 Underworld Contact as well. This might be a little too slow, however if you have got the piece on hand, why not play it? Don't give away what Mr. Li offers you...

End game: There are three possible ways to end the game, depending on the ICE and ICE depth on Archives as well as Agenda development of the croporation. 1. Pump Crypsis, then make a run on Archives. Normally you will sit on 20+credits, so this should not be the problem. Swordsman gives you the middle finger, so in case you know the corp plays it you should have a second Crypsis as backup. 2. Deck the corp. This will take about 2 or 3 turns longer than the first possibility, so use it only when the corp is not on matchpoint.

name: NBN #3 - Restructuring News v2
description:
===== v2 ===== -2 MMC -3 Celebrity Gift -1 Draco -3 Pop-up Window +2 Scorched Earth +3 Sweeps Week +2 Muckraker +2 Data Raven ===== =====

1) Cheap ices early on to be able to play Restructure. If cheap/economy ices are not drawn early on, Celebrity Gift and MMC are there as second plans to reach 10 credits easily.

2) Use the credits to score agenda : - by fast advancement (big ices and SanSan) - by tags (Midseason Replacements + Psychosographics)

Jackson Howard is of great help here : - to draw the card we need to ramp up to 10 credits - to shuffle back archives to R&D (because of Celebrity Gift)

name: Exile - Your heap is your 2nd grip
description: I tried to optimise the decklist of Ecowarmachine. A Maker's Eye Run, if the Corp is at matchpoint, cheaper memory, and only one Levy AR Lab Access.

name: NBN #3 - Restructuring News v2
description:
Update to integrate new cards.

I replaced Midseason by ChiLo since a rich runner is hard to tag with Midseason. ChiLo on HQ with TMI is a good defense against Siphon. With TGBT in hand, it is much better :-)

I hesitated between Closed Account and Hellion Alpha Test but i choosed to splash Hellion because it could be hard to tag a cautious runner, hence Closed Account is useless. Hellion is awesome in late game to trash Kati Jones with 9+ credits. I had the choice between 1 Closed Accounts and 1 Hellion but i prefer to have 2 Hellion in order to have a better chance to have 1 in hand when i want to.

name: Replicating Perfection - Strong Ice
description: I am actually playing this deck. Its mostly strong ice. As long as my economy is working, everything is fine. For a strong economy I do have Mental Health Clinic (usually without strong ice, maybe something cheap to intimidate the enemy) and of course Sundew (well-protected).

name: Replicating Perfection - Expensive Ice
description: I changed my setting to a more expensive one. Haven't tried it jet, but I hope, that the income wouldn't be a problem.

name: HB_Engineering.1.1.1.1
description:
First HB deck from scratch.

Trying to take advantage of some HB:EtF features:

  • some extra upgrades to take advantage of install credit
  • not shy about heavy, expensive ice, hoping for Priority Requisition and Accelerated Beta Test to get them installed (along with decent economy based more on installed assets than operations.
  • hoping Archived Memories can offset the dangers of Accelerated Beta Test
  • hoping to pick up extra clicks with Biotic Labor and Mandatory Upgrades
  • SanSan City Grid to help with heavy advancement req on Mandatory Upgrades
  • relying on Priority Requisition and Accelerated Beta Test (backed up with Archived Memories) to rez heavy ice will be tricky to pull off. Hoping to use Research Station and Aggressive Negotiation. Research Station to hold cards longer and Aggressive Negotiation to get the cards in hand when I am ready for them.

name: Now For The Main Event
Hey Man, Slow Down...
description:
The idea is to drain the Corp's money through ice taxation and Vamp and delay the agenda scoring with The Source. Fall Guy prevents The Source from being trashed and Nerve Agent is great because once the Corp can't score, the HQ will be pilled up with agendas. As a lot of agendas will fall down on archives, its needless to say that Jackson is a problem.

Please send some suggestions!

name: Overmind + Deep Red + Scavenge + Testrun + Feedback Implants
description: Suggestions to improve the deck are very welcome!

name: Darwin + Datasucker + Parasite + Djinn + Knight
Super-Aggressive Activist
description: A super early aggression, tag-me anarch deck without a fixed breaker suite, working with Overmind, Crypsis, Knight. Also relying on a Blackmail + Activist Support and Rook + Accoun Syphon combos. Quick econ resources (because of tags) and everything that profits from being tagged or just doesn't really matter if tagged again. Special thanks to Steven Wooley and his 2014 Colorado Regional - 1st Place Runner Deck for inspiration (http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/5823/2014-colorado-regional-1st-place-runner) and his anatomy of anarchy post (http://teamcovenant.com/botounami/2014/05/20/anatomy-of-anarchy/) which opened my eyes about playing an anarch the right way.

name: Silhouette of Infiltration
description: A very early in development deck which evolved from my earlier idea of a Blackguard Reina Roja (http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/5722/black-and-redguard-1-1) which became a criminal, because of econ, card daw and tutoing as well as less splashing. The deck is based upon a Blackguard + Snitch (or Silhouettes ability) + Xanadu mix and easy breaking. It's still pretty early though.

name: SA Core Criminal
NBN Red Slow FA
description:
Taxing NBN with both Ash AND Red Herrings.

Inspired by: http://stimhack.com/slowing-down-fast-advance/

I probably should fit in a Fast Track or some other H&P goodness somewhere, but I'm not sure what to cut for it.

name: HB Arcology trap variant
description: Variant with Aggressive Secretary instead of Closed Accounts.

name: Eventromeda
description:
Andromedas big start hand makes Prepaid VoicePADs and Event Economy Appealing in Criminal even without the additional card draw of shaper.

I opted to not go for the Anarch Breaker Suite since that is more costly in influence and is more difficult to set up. Maker's Eye is a very crucial card to spend influence on. As is Levy AR Lab Access since it is both important for getting a trashed breaker back as well as keeping me strong in the late game when Kati Jones is not enough economy to keep up and all the juicy multi-access cards are already gone.

The exact Event composition is very much debatable - I like Planned Assault instead of additional copies of Legwork and Inside Job so I can choose whether to focus on R&D with Maker's Eye or Legwork HQ or Inside Job that one-iced remote. It opens up a lot of versatility but at the cost of having fewer overall run events. Same Old thing is there to recycle those events as appropriate if the corp doesn't close the hole in his defense soon. More often than not I find myself reusing Maker's Eyes and Legwork instead of Account Siphon.

Lawyer Up is nice when it works, but definitely not essential. FOA and Emergency Shutdown really change importance depending on the matchup you're facing, so not sure how I should adjust that composition.

I try to avoid going tag-me since Mr. Li is such a great way to find what you need earlier and to control how much money you want to draw right now. That is so useful I even prefer to use the first Hostage on Mr. Li instead of Kati Jones. Maybe including Mr. Li and Kati Jones is against the spirit of an event based deck and they don't permit me to keep tags and force me to include the otherwise useless Hostages, but I found they are a really important part of this deck.

name: Psionic Scorcha' Killa'
description:
Hey there,

This is a deck I've been having loads of fun playing with so far. Given the fact that many cards depend on the "psi mini-game" I wouldn't use it (or this ID so far as a matter of fact) at a tournament but I've had reasonably decent success with it.

It's intended to either flatline the runner or just leave agendas in the open and triple advance them the next turn. Below I'll show you how this is possible.

AGENDAS:

  • The Future Perfect: this is the odd one of the group, it's not intended for scoring. Instead cycle it through your hand and RnD when need be but it's just there as a 3 point filler and adds to the nisei fun times cannon.

  • False Lead: Get one of those scored ASAP once you feel comfortable with your set-up and whatnot. One could be your bread and butter for achieving victory as it combos with A) Psychic Field (if you win the psi game, deny the runner the chance to draw and neural EMP him) B) Landing a tag with a snare that is impossible to shake off for a scorch C) that little 1 pointer out of the group of 7 you need.

  • Braintrust: 3/2 nuff said

  • Medical Breakthrough: averages out to being a 3/2 (nuff said lol)

  • Philotic Entanglement: you see where this is going ;)

ASSETS

  • Snare!: this will be your main way to land tags moreso than the deliciously fun net damage to boot...

  • Psychic Field: your main trap for installs, just install them whenever you feel like it and that will scare the runner enough for you to be able to just spam the odd 3/2 or Flase Lead in between.

  • Jackson (Jesus) Howard: Just does what he does best, draw up to a decent kill combo and return your snares and overdrawn agendas into RnD.

UPGRADES

-Caprice Nisei: auto include in any nisei division deck. period.

OPERATIONS

-Cerebral cast: what can I say? stick the runner between a rock and a hard place If you "psychic fielded" them already they generally HAVE to pick the tag and there's your 1-2 punch.

-Hedge Fund: classic econ.

-Medical Research Fundraiser: This is a deck that isn't trying to tax too much or beat the runner credit for credit to achieve it's goals. Just seems appropriate because everything is cheap so it allows for more card slots with easy burst econ. In this deck bluffing is very important so Celebrity Gift may actually harm as much as help.

-Neural EMP: mandatory, can't picture this kind of flatline archetype without it

-Scorched earth: the big debate here was whether or not to put 3 and through testing it works best to get one as early as possible.

ICE

Ok this is slightly trickier, It's still up for debate which ICE is best to use and the deck doesn't pack a huge punch (especially against RnD locks). I built it this way mostly based on my local meta where parasite recursion is as popular as ever.

  • Himitsu-Bako: meh, gets the job done

-Snowflake: your other barrier that can wind up acting like soewhat of a pop up.

-Chum: I actually found it easy to install early on and scare the runner from continuing.

-Yagura: My Jinteki auto-include code gate of choice!

-Hunter: works great with chum since it's already a 4 strengh for a cheap rez cost. the tag is a bonus and helps with mind games when using cerebral casts.

-Komainu: i"m still "???" about this one. I'm scared of parasites and even with chum it's easily bypassed by mimics.

-Neural Katana: blah the payoff is cool.

name: Garden of the Ronin v1.6
The Chairman
description: The objective of this deck is to get the runner down and then keep kicking until they flatline. The first goal is to get a Chariman Hiro down as quick as possible and bump him with Encryption protocols to make him even harder to steal. With extra ice from Bioroid to deal Brain damage and Komainu to tear up the remaining scraps, this Corp deck could make quick work of any Runner. And if that fails, just start scoring Medical Breakthroughs and that Philotic Entanglement.

name: Never Leave Home Without a Knife v0.3
description:
Taking the core of the Dagger-Brush archetype, and applying it to this enigma of a runner. Nasir loves to facecheck, and the Dagger build allows you to do so safely. With so many recurring credits, you shouldn't have any issues with losing your credit pool. The non-killer breakers both maintain strength throughout the run, so that makes you more flexible with where you spend your money, too.

Personal Workshop seems like an auto-include with Nasir.

ProCo is also perfect for Nasir. Most runners find it to be a huge tempo loss if dropped first turn. Not him. Drop it, facecheck your way to riches! It's also the perfect economy card, as it allows you to dig up all the cards you want to put in Workshops.

Stimhack is great with PW. Escher is just as situational here as it is anywhere else, and I'm not sold on Tinkering, but this deck is untested, what with Nasir being unreleased and all. I just find him fascinating.

I've dropped Pheromones and Imp, as much as they could be great, for Morning Star. This gives him great late-game power against multi-sub ICE, an alternate plan for paintbrushing, it works well with PW and, most importantly, gives all his breakers a weapon theme.

I considered running Scavange for placing Daggers on Dino and saving me the order of install silliness, but Dagger is cheap enough that installing a new one isn't out of the question.

name: Kate'n Friends
Jinteki Taxing Perfection
description:
So, still relatively new to netrunner. Here is a deck that has been doing really well for me so far. Not super original, basis of the deck is heavily taxing the runner as much and often as possible. Most of the agendas in the deck tax either through net damage, costing the runner to steal, or both. The ice is focused on a mix of end the runs and a significant amount of damage to discourage facechecking. Goal is to ice up centrals heavily, get a solid ETR ice on any sundews that I draw, and set up a solid scoring remote and either force the runner to make risky decisions and risk being flatlined or I score out 7 slowly for the win.

Comments, things to improve?

Currently looking at guard, may consider either dropping it down to 2 and picking up another ice, or ditching it completely and going for something cheaper and/or stronger.

name: Trace and Tag
Program Kate
Agenda Quest DSV
description: Deck I plan on running with at the 2014 regional tournament coming up in June. So far has done really well with play tests, any input would be great thanks guys.
